records.full_caption: Fig. 2 Colourimetric a*b* (CIE 1976 L*a*b* Color Space) colour coordinates of thin films of P1 taken as a function of level of electrochemical oxidation (180 to 1080 mV vs. Fc/Fc+, 50 mV steps), with inset photographs of the three films of differing optical density (A) studied in their neutral (180 mV) and fully oxidized (1080 mV) states. The neutral-state optical density of each film at 455 nm is listed next to each photoset.
records.caption: Fig. 2 Colourimetric a*b* (CIE 1976 L*a*b* Color Space) colour coordinates of thin films of P1 taken as a function of level of electrochemical oxidation (180 to 1080 mV vs. Fc/Fc+, 50 mV steps), with inset photographs of the three films of differing optical density (A) studied in their neutral (180 mV) and fully oxidized (1080 mV) states. The neutral-state optical density of each film at 455 nm is listed next to each photoset.

records.full_caption: Fig. 3 Potential square wave absorptometry of P1 (measured at 455 nm, 180 to 1080 mV vs. Fc/Fc+ in 0.2 M Li BTI/PC solution, Pt wire CTE). The time each potential was held is indicated by τ and the transmittance contrast by ΔT.
records.caption: Fig. 3 Potential square wave absorptometry of P1 (measured at 455 nm, 180 to 1080 mV vs. Fc/Fc+ in 0.2 M Li BTI/PC solution, Pt wire CTE). The time each potential was held is indicated by τ and the transmittance contrast by ΔT.

records.full_caption: Fig. 1 Spectroelectrochemical analysis P1. A thin film was spray-cast from a ~2 mg mL−1 solution in toluene, and electrochemical oxidation was carried out in 0.2 M lithium bis(trifluoromethanesulfonimide (LiBTI)/propylene carbonate (PC) solution, using a Ag/Ag+ reference electrode (10 mM AgNO3/0.1 M Bu4NPF6 in MeCN, calibrated to the Fc/Fc+ redox couple, E1/2Fc/Fc+ = EAg/Ag+ = 80 mV) and a Pt wire counter electrode. The applied potential was increased in 50 mV steps from 180 mV to 1080 mV vs. Fc/Fc+.
records.caption: Fig. 1 Spectroelectrochemical analysis P1. A thin film was spray-cast from a ~2 mg mL−1 solution in toluene, and electrochemical oxidation was carried out in 0.2 M lithium bis(trifluoromethanesulfonimide (LiBTI)/propylene carbonate (PC) solution, using a Ag/Ag+ reference electrode (10 mM AgNO3/0.1 M Bu4NPF6 in MeCN, calibrated to the Fc/Fc+ redox couple, E1/2Fc/Fc+ = EAg/Ag+ = 80 mV) and a Pt wire counter electrode. The applied potential was increased in 50 mV steps from 180 mV to 1080 mV vs. Fc/Fc+.

records.full_caption: Fig. 4 (a) Thin films of blue, red, and yellow polymers spray-cast onto ITO slides through circular shadow masks. (b) Thinner films are immersed in a tetrabutylammonium hexafluorophosphate (TBAPF6)/PC solution and held at −0.25 V (left) and 1.2 V (right) vs. Ag wire.
records.caption: Thin films of blue, red, and yellow polymers spray-cast onto ITO slides through circular shadow masks.
